Background and Analysis:
	 
The Sound Fiscal Management Self-Assessment Checklist report is prepared each fiscal year by district Business Office staff as an additional step in the overall process of ensuring fiscal stability and continuous scrutiny of district business practices and operations. Although completion of the report on an annual basis is recommended by the state chancellor’s office, it is not a requirement. FHDA chooses to produce the report each year because it is viewed by staff as a valuable tool for our own internal fiscal assessment and provides a comprehensive narrative document that is presented to both the Audit and Finance committee and the Board of Trustees.
	 
	 
	 
Submitted by:
Kevin McElroy, Vice Chancellor of Business Services, ext 6201
Additional contact names:
Hector Quinonez, Controller, Joni Hayes, Interim Director, Budget Operations

Background and Analysis:
	 
Education Code Section 84040(b) requires that each governing board of each community college district provide an annual audit of all funds, books, and accounts of the district in accordance with regulations of the Board of Governors.  Vavrinek, Trine, Day, & Company, LLP (VTD), Certified Public Accountants, located in Pleasanton, California, completed the Foothill-De Anza Community College District annual audit for the year ended June 30, 2013, and the Board of Trustees accepted the audit report at their December 9, 2013 Board Meeting.
	 
The District audit report noted one audit finding and recommendation, which was minor, deemed immaterial, and has been corrected.  A copy of the audit findings and recommendations is attached, which includes management’s response.
	 
The separate Management Recommendation Letter which was prepared by VTD and presented along with the District Audit Report, made notice of one area that provides an opportunity for strengthening internal controls and operating efficiency – capital asset management. A copy of the Management Recommendation Letter is attached, which includes management’s response.
	 
	 
Submitted by:
Kevin McElroy, Vice Chancellor of Business Services, x6201
Additional contact names:
Hector Quinonez, Controller
Is backup provided?
Yes

items.item_details:
Background and Analysis:
	 
	 
The District contracts with an independent certified public accounting firm, Vavrinek, Trine, Day & Co., LLP (VTD), to perform operational reviews, also known as performance audits, in areas jointly identified by management and the Audit & Finance Committee.
	 
The District also contract separately with VTD to perform the annual District Financial Audit, Measure C Performance Audit, Measure C Financial Audit, Foothill-De Anza Community Colleges Foundation Audit, and the corresponding foundation tax return.  In order to strengthen the principle of independence, best practice would be to select a Certified Public Accounting (CPA) firm to perform the District's operational reviews separate from the CPA firm that performs the District's year-end financial audit.
	 
VTD is scheduled to finalize an operational review of our procurement card by June 30, 2014.  The contract for VTD to perform the annual financial audit is for a period of 5 years and will expire with the June 30, 2015 audit.  The District will issue a Request for Proposal (RFP) prior to commencement of the fiscal year 2015-16 annual financial audit.
	 
A qualified CPA firm may be selected from the pool of candidates at the time that we go out with the RFP for the fiscal year 2015-16 annual financial audit.  The firm that is selected to perform operational reviews could be the 2nd choice CPA firm that is not selected for the annual financial audit.
	 
For fiscal year 2014-15, the Vice Chancellor of Business Services would select a CPA firm to perform operational reviews from the list of CPA firms provided by the County Office of Education or from the list of CPA firms that audit community college districts, available from the California Community Colleges Chancellor’s Office. 
	 
	 
Submitted by:
Kevin McElroy, Vice Chancellor of Business Services, x6201
